title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. title: Contributing to sentimentanalyzerR

title: Contributing to sentimentanalyzerR
text: core team members work feature branch. contributions expected go code review via pull request (PR). branch protection rule set main branch (currently least 1 reviewer required). shouldn’t exist commits main branch, except ones created team merged branches. Team members review changes approve PR within 7 days. Team members git pull get latest version project making changes. General contribution steps: git pull obtain latest changes remote repository git switch -c , branch_name name new feature branch Modify code & test code git add , add modified files git commit -m “msg”, commit changes meaningful commit message git push –set-upstream origin , pushing local changes new branch remote Submit PR teammates review PR within 7 days, approve PR add comments necessary Merge branch

title: Contributing to sentimentanalyzerR
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to sentimentanalyzerR
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to sentimentanalyzerR
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("UBC-MDS/sentimentanalyzerR", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to sentimentanalyzerR
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: sentimentanalyzerR
text: document gives overview sentimentanalyzerR package corresponding functions. package written enable beginner level users R conveniently translate given text data graphical illustrations draw immediate insights. useful especially survey obtained large number respondents spanning across thousands rows. package summarizes major sentiment reviews aggregated scores plots. start using package, follow installation section README file install package. import package using following code.
code: library(sentimentanalyzerR)

title: sentimentanalyzerR
text: Compound Score - score range -1 1 represents general opinion document. computed using valence score word document. Valence score score calculated word based connotation context usage sentence. Likert Scale - Likert scale used questionnaires enable respondents provide level agreement disagreement symmetric scale. scale can orientated either increasing decreasing order. found wide applications field statistics, psychology, business sciences. level scale perceived evenly spaced intensity agreement/disagreement. Wordcloud - condensed representation selected words highest influence towards particular sentiment category. size text relative frequency occurrence document/corpus.

title: sentimentanalyzerR
text: section provides walk-package functions. sample dataset included use case demonstration purposes. get_aggregated_sentiment_score - Computes majors sentiment population. likert_scale - Converts sentiment score likert scale ranging 1-5. sentiment_score_plot - Creates binned histogram showing count reviews sentiment score. generate_wordcloud - Creates wordcloud common positive, negative neutral words.

title: sentimentanalyzerR
text: One popular Use Cases sentiment analysis understanding general sentiment tweets major event. demonstration Use case, utilize tweets data set.
code: # Loading the library and selecting the top 200 rows for the demonstration library(readr) df <- read_csv("../tests/test_tweets.csv") df <- head(df, 200)

title: sentimentanalyzerR

code: score <- aggregate_sentiment_score(df, "text")  # view the computed score score #> [1] -0.14501

title: sentimentanalyzerR
text: output previous function interpretable spread across sentiment scale -1 +1. make understandable common user, call convert_to_likert function . returns overall score likert . return value 3 corresponds “Neutral” sentiment per Likert scale mentioned function documentation.
code: likert_score <- likert_scale(df, "text")  # view the likert scale score likert_score #> [1] 3

title: Analyzes sentiment from text data
text: can install development version sentimentanalyzerR GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("UBC-MDS/sentimentanalyzerR")

title: Analyzes sentiment from text data
text: package provides following 4 functions: generate_wordcloud - Create wordcloud common positive negative words. get_aggregated_sentiment_score - Calculates overall sentiment score input texts. likert_scale - Converts sentiment score likert scale ranging 1-5. sentiment_score_plot - Creates binned histogram showing count reviews sentiment score. general, functions take data frame column name parameters.

title: Analyzes sentiment from text data
text: exists many packages libraries sentiment analysis many projects built top packages, find specific packages combines use sentiment analysis visualizations. However, expect many projects done individuals likely perform similar functions making use existing NLP packages. package aims enhance existing NLP packages providing quick simple way generate summary visualizations. package similar following existing packages: wordcloud tidytext

title: Analyzes sentiment from text data

Check contributing guidelines. Please note project released Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.
